newsitem.title: USA: Western Resources says reaches rate deal.
newsitem.headline: Western Resources says reaches rate deal.

text.p: Western Resources said Wednesday it reached a multi-year settlement agreement that will provide for a total decrease in electric rates of $75 million over four years, plus $10 million in rebates.
The settlement deals with electric rate decreases for customers of its two units, Kansas Gas and Electric Co (KGE) and Kansas Power & Light Co (KPL).

Western said the new settlement, reached with the Kansas Corporation Commission (KCC) staff, the Citizens' Utility Ratepayers Board and the City of Wichita, replaces the previous two-year rate reduction plan.

Western said the agreement also supports Western's projected earnings calculations in its merger plans with Kansas City Power & Light Co Inc, and requires no change in previously filed financial projections regarding that transaction.

"The agreement reached late yesterday accommodates the interests of all parties while allowing our company to remain financially strong," John E. Hayes, Jr., Western Resources chairman and CEO, said in a statement.
